abstract.p: Columbia University names Jeanette C Takamura as dean of its School of Social Work (S)

block.p: Columbia University named JEANETTE C. TAKAMURA, the assistant secretary for aging at the federal Department of Health and Human Services from 1997 to 2001, as dean of its School of Social Work. Since June 2001, she has held the Edward R. Roybal endowed chair in applied gerontology and public service at California State University at Los Angeles. When Dr. Takamura, who is from Hawaii, takes office on July 1, she will be the first woman in the post. She succeeds RONALD FELDMAN, who stepped down in June 2001 after 15 years. Before moving to Washington, Dr. Takamura was a leader of Hawaii's Department of Health.

Columbia University named JEANETTE C. TAKAMURA, the assistant secretary for aging at the federal Department of Health and Human Services from 1997 to 2001, as dean of its School of Social Work. Since June 2001, she has held the Edward R. Roybal endowed chair in applied gerontology and public service at California State University at Los Angeles. When Dr. Takamura, who is from Hawaii, takes office on July 1, she will be the first woman in the post. She succeeds RONALD FELDMAN, who stepped down in June 2001 after 15 years. Before moving to Washington, Dr. Takamura was a leader of Hawaii's Department of Health.
